sentences.en: A few sheep have been lost from the flock.
A flock of birds comes over, and the hunting starts.
sentences.cn: 一群鸟飞过来, 打猎开始了.

sentences.en: A flock of birds flew towards us slowly from far away.
sentences.cn: 一群鸟儿从远处朝我们缓缓飞来。

sentences.en: A flock of birds was already warbling a cheerful morning chorus.
sentences.cn: 一群鸟儿已经齐声唱起了欢快的晨曲。

sentences.en: A flock of crows wheeled overhead.
sentences.cn: 一群乌鸦在头顶上盘旋。

sentences.en: A flock of customers were waiting for the store to open.
sentences.cn: 一群顾客在等候着商店开门.

sentences.en: A flock of sea gulls are hovering over the deck.
sentences.cn: 一群海鸥在甲板上空飞翔.

sentences.en: a small flock of laying hens
Have you ever observed that birds of a feather flock together? In other words, people who are similar become friends or do things together.
sentences.cn: 你观察过吗“物以类聚，人以群分”？换句话说，性格相似的人总是会成为朋友，或者在一起做事情。

sentences.en: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
The criticisms will not stop people flocking to see the film.
sentences.cn: 这些批评阻止不了涌向看这部影片的人潮。

sentences.en: The flock of birds scattered when a shot was fired.
The priest warned his flock against breaking God's law.
sentences.cn: 牧师警告他的教友不要违背上帝的训诫.

sentences.en: The public has flocked to the show.
sentences.cn: 公众蜂拥而去看那场演出。

sentences.en: The shepherd re - collect his flock.
sentences.cn: 牧人重新聚集起他的羊群.

sentences.en: They kept a small flock of sheep.

trans.tran_cn: 兽群，鸟群，一大群人，教徒，软棉填料
trans.tran_en: a group of sheep, goats, or birds
to go or gather together somewhere in large numbers
If people flock to a particular place or event, a very large number of them go there, usually because it is pleasant or interesting
